description: A gloomy island in the Grand Line, home to Dracule Mihawk's castle and inhabited by intelligent Humandrills who have learned to use weapons.

keyEvents.title: Zoro Battles Humandrills
keyEvents.description: Zoro fights against intelligent Humandrills on the island while still recovering from his injuries.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the dangerous nature of the island and the challenges Zoro faces in his training location.

keyEvents.title: Mihawk Returns to His Island
keyEvents.description: Mihawk appears and his presence alone scares away all the Humandrills attacking Zoro.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes Mihawk's dominance over the island and its inhabitants.

keyEvents.title: Mihawk Informs Zoro About Ace
keyEvents.description: Mihawk explains to Zoro about the events at Marineford and Ace's death.
keyEvents.significance: The island serves as the setting for Zoro to learn about his captain's tragedy.

geography.terrain: Forested island with ruins and a castle

description: An island inhabited by giant birds and a primitive human tribe. The island is where Tony Tony Chopper was sent by Bartholomew Kuma.

keyEvents.title: Chopper Mediates Between Tribe and Birds
keyEvents.description: Chopper helps the human tribe befriend the giant birds, resolving conflict on the island.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates Chopper's ability to communicate with different species and his role as a bridge between humans and animals.

keyEvents.title: Chopper Receives News at Birdie Kingdom
keyEvents.description: Chopper receives a newspaper about Ace's death while on the island.
keyEvents.significance: The peaceful island becomes the setting for Chopper to learn devastating news.

description: A sky island dedicated to the study of weather science, floating in the sky. It is inhabited by weather scientists led by Haredas.

keyEvents.title: Nami Works in Weather Fields
keyEvents.description: Nami is shown working hard labor cultivating Weather Balls as part of her apprenticeship.
keyEvents.significance: Shows Nami's training in advanced weather science that will enhance her abilities.

keyEvents.title: Nami Receives News at Weatheria
keyEvents.description: A News Coo delivers a newspaper to Nami with the news about Ace's death.
keyEvents.significance: Even in the sky, news reaches the scattered Straw Hats.

geography.terrain: Floating sky island with weather research facilities

description: A group of islands that are actually giant carnivorous plants disguised as islands. The abundant food on the surface is used to lure prey.

keyEvents.title: Usopp's Weight Gain Revealed
keyEvents.description: Usopp is shown severely overweight from eating too much of the island's abundant food.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates the danger of the island's deceptive nature and Usopp's lack of discipline.

keyEvents.title: Usopp Receives News on Boin
keyEvents.description: Usopp knocks down a News Coo and reads about Ace's death.
keyEvents.significance: Even the remote Boin Archipelago receives world news.

geography.terrain: Carnivorous plant islands disguised as normal islands

description: An island kingdom inhabited entirely by okamas (crossdressers/transvestites). It is the home of Emporio Ivankov and the okama style of martial arts.

keyEvents.title: Sanji's Okama Transformation
keyEvents.description: Sanji is shown dressed as an okama, having been influenced by his time on the island.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the humorous and challenging situation Sanji faces, which motivates his training.

keyEvents.title: Sanji Returns to Normal After Shocking News
keyEvents.description: The shock of Ace's death snaps Sanji back to his normal appearance.
keyEvents.significance: Provides both comic relief and emotional weight to the episode.

geography.terrain: Island kingdom with castles and towns

description: A massive bridge being constructed by slave labor for the World Government. The bridge has been under construction for 700 years, connecting islands in the East Blue.

keyEvents.title: Robin Meets Revolutionary Army
keyEvents.description: Robin speaks with Revolutionary Army members who freed the slaves at Tequila Wolf and invite her to join them.
keyEvents.significance: This is the only canon scene in the episode, establishing the Revolutionary Army's interest in Robin.

keyEvents.title: Robin Chooses Her Crew
keyEvents.description: Robin declines the Revolutionary Army's invitation and chooses to reunite with the Straw Hats.
keyEvents.significance: Shows Robin's loyalty and the location where she makes this important decision.

geography.terrain: Massive bridge under construction spanning islands

description: Also known as the 'Future Island Baldimore,' this is the birthplace of Dr. Vegapunk. The island is filled with advanced technology and mechanical inventions.

keyEvents.title: Franky Discovers Cola and Technology
keyEvents.description: Franky finds cola and defeats an animal in Dr. Vegapunk's laboratory, with advanced machines printing out news.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the advanced technology of the island that Franky will use to upgrade himself.

keyEvents.title: Franky Receives News via Technology
keyEvents.description: Franky learns about Ace's death through a printed paper from Vegapunk's machines.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates the island's unique way of receiving information through advanced technology.

geography.terrain: Snowy island with advanced mechanical structures

description: Also known as Hungaria or the Poverty Kingdom, this is a poor island kingdom where Brook was sent by Bartholomew Kuma.

keyEvents.title: Brook Composes Music
keyEvents.description: Brook is shown composing music and attempting poses, maintaining his cheerful personality.
keyEvents.significance: Shows Brook's musical activities and provides comic relief during the somber episode.

keyEvents.title: Brook Receives News at Harahettania
keyEvents.description: Brook receives a newspaper and learns about Ace's death.
keyEvents.significance: Even the cheerful Brook is affected by the devastating news.
